businessLogic

Class OrderBusinessLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • businessLogic.OrderBusinessLogic

  • public class OrderBusinessLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the application with a working layer between the UI and the classes that access the database.
    Since:
    Apr 06, 2020
    Author:
    Coroian Tudor

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private OrderAccess orderAccess
      The instance of the ClientAccess.java class to access the database.
      private OrderItemBusinessLogic orderItemBLL
      The instance of the OrderItemBusinessLogic.java class to cascade the delete operation.
      private java.util.List<Validator<Orders>> validators
      The list of specific validators for this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OrderBusinessLogic()
      The constructor of this class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cascadeDelete(Orders order)
      This method cascades the delete operation done on an order such that all the order items that belonged to the order specified as the parameter are deleted as well.
      void cascadeUpdate(Orders order)
      This method cascades the update operation such that if the id of the order given as the parameter is changed, it should change across all the order items that are part of this order.
      int deleteOrder(Orders order)
      This method updates the "deleted" column of the client specified as the parameter to "true" or 1.
      int deleteOrderById(int id)
      This method updates the "deleted" column of the order with the id specified as the parameter to "true" or 1
      java.util.List<Orders> findAllOrders() 
      Orders findOrderById(int id)
      This method returns the order with the id specified as the parameter or throws an NoSuchElementException if it is not found.
      java.util.List<Orders> findOrdersByClientId(Client client)
      This method returns a list with all the orders of the client whose id is equal to the one specified as the parameter of the method.
      int insertOrder(Orders order)
      This method inserts an order specified as the parameter into the database and if the entry with the same id as the order specified in the argument was already inserted in the database.
      int updateOrder(Orders order)
      This method updates the database at the entry specified as the parameter.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrderBusinessLogic

        public OrderBusinessLogic()
        The constructor of this class. It instantiate all the specific validators for this class and the class that accesses the database

    • Method Detail

      • findOrderById

        public Orders findOrderById(int id)
        This method returns the order with the id specified as the parameter or throws an NoSuchElementException if it is not found.
        Parameters:
        id - : int
        Returns:
        the order with the id specified as a parameter

      • findAllOrders

        public java.util.List<Orders> findAllOrders()
        Returns:
        a list with all the orders in the database or null if an error is encountered.

      • findOrdersByClientId

        public java.util.List<Orders> findOrdersByClientId(Client client)
        This method returns a list with all the orders of the client whose id is equal to the one specified as the parameter of the method.
        Parameters:
        client - : Client
        Returns:
        a list with all the orders of the client with id_client equal with id or null in case of errors

      • insertOrder

        public int insertOrder(Orders order)
        This method inserts an order specified as the parameter into the database and if the entry with the same id as the order specified in the argument was already inserted in the database. Then, this method attempts to update the previously found entry.
        Parameters:
        order - : Order
        Returns:
        0 if the insert was done successfully, 1 if the entry was updated and -1 in case of errors

      • updateOrder

        public int updateOrder(Orders order)
        This method updates the database at the entry specified as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        order - : Order
        Returns:
        0 if the update was done successfully and -1 otherwise

      • deleteOrder

        public int deleteOrder(Orders order)
        This method updates the "deleted" column of the client specified as the parameter to "true" or 1.
        Parameters:
        order - : Order
        Returns:
        0 if the update was done successfully and -1 otherwise

      • deleteOrderById

        public int deleteOrderById(int id)
        This method updates the "deleted" column of the order with the id specified as the parameter to "true" or 1
        Parameters:
        id - : int
        Returns:
        0 if the order was deleted successfully and -1 otherwise

      • cascadeDelete

        public void cascadeDelete(Orders order)
        This method cascades the delete operation done on an order such that all the order items that belonged to the order specified as the parameter are deleted as well.
        Parameters:
        order - : Order

      • cascadeUpdate

        public void cascadeUpdate(Orders order)
        This method cascades the update operation such that if the id of the order given as the parameter is changed, it should change across all the order items that are part of this order.
        Parameters:
        order - : Order
